intro: Lycianthes bigeminata, commonly known as the two-seeded physalis, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico and the Caribbean. The plant produces distinctive lantern-shaped fruit that encloses its seeds, a feature shared with other members of the Physalis genus. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals, and it thrives in warm, tropical climates. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
